events.title: India Gains Independence from British Rule
events.description: India officially gained its independence from British colonial rule on August 15, 1947, becoming a sovereign nation after nearly 200 years of British dominance.
events.significance: Marked the end of British colonial rule in India and the birth of the world's largest democracy.

events.title: End of World War II in Asia - Victory over Japan Day (V-J Day)
events.description: Japan formally surrendered to the Allied forces on August 15, 1945, effectively ending World War II in Asia after nearly six years of conflict.
events.significance: Signified the conclusion of the deadliest conflict in human history and led to significant geopolitical changes worldwide.

events.title: Woodstock Music & Art Fair Begins
events.description: The iconic Woodstock festival started on August 15, 1969, drawing hundreds of thousands of people to a music festival symbolizing the counterculture movement of the 1960s.
events.significance: Became a defining moment of 1960s youth culture and music history.

events.title: First Battle of the Marne Begins
events.description: On August 15, 1914, during World War I, the First Battle of the Marne commenced, halting the German advance into France and setting the stage for trench warfare.
events.significance: Marked a critical turning point in WWI, preventing a quick German victory in the West.
